articles.headline: Lured by Pre-Brexit Bargain, German Buyer Goes on London Real Estate Spree
articles.snippet: Grand City Properties’ acquisition might be expected to offer relief to a real-estate market nervously awaiting Britain’s scheduled exit from the European Union. But that isn’t necessarily happening.
articles.abstract: Grand City Properties’ acquisition might be expected to offer relief to a real-estate market nervously awaiting Britain’s scheduled exit from the European Union. But that isn’t necessarily happening.
articles.lead_paragraph: The view south from Hill House, a 14-story apartment block perched on a hill in North London, is about as spectacular as it gets in the sprawling British capital.

articles.headline: This Stock Market Rally Has Everything, Except Investors
articles.snippet: Companies keep buying huge quantities of their own shares, propelling prices higher even as pensions, mutual funds and individuals sit on their hands.
articles.abstract: Companies keep buying huge quantities of their own shares, propelling prices higher even as pensions, mutual funds and individuals sit on their hands.
articles.lead_paragraph: Armchair investors have been selling stock.

articles.headline: It’s Mueller’s Investigation. But Right Behind Him Is Andrew Goldstein.
articles.snippet: The special counsel has a reputation as the all-knowing investigator, but Andrew D. Goldstein, a former Time magazine reporter, has a day-to-day role in one of the central lines of investigation.
articles.abstract: The special counsel has a reputation as the all-knowing investigator, but Andrew D. Goldstein, a former Time magazine reporter, has a day-to-day role in one of the central lines of investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The routine was always the same. President Trump’s lawyers would drive to heavily secured offices near the National Mall, surrender their cellphones, head into a windowless conference room and resume tense negotiations over whether the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, would interview Mr. Trump.
articles.byline: By Noah Weiland and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Do Two Troubled Banks Make One Good One? Germany May Find Out
articles.snippet: Amid speculation that Berlin will push a merger of Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank to ensure Germany has one big league lender, here are the pros and cons.
articles.abstract: Amid speculation that Berlin will push a merger of Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank to ensure Germany has one big league lender, here are the pros and cons.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Deutsche Bank managers used to boast that theirs was one of the few global investment banks to survive the financial crisis without a government bailout.

articles.headline: In ‘Green Book’ Victory, Oscar Critics See an Old Hollywood Tale
articles.snippet: Critics of the film say it oversimplifies race relations. Its best-picture win complicated a night when the academy honored a diverse set of winners.
articles.abstract: Critics of the film say it oversimplifies race relations. Its best-picture win complicated a night when the academy honored a diverse set of winners.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Something seismic was happening during the Academy Awards ceremony on Sunday night. The Hollywood establishment, excoriated for its longtime exclusion of women and minorities, recognized African-American production design and costume virtuosos for the first time. Asian-American filmmakers were honored. A movie about a gay rock star collected four trophies.

articles.headline: S.E.C. Asks Court to Hold Tesla’s Elon Musk in Contempt for Twitter Post on Production
articles.snippet: Mr. Musk violated a settlement when he published information about production goals without seeking approval from his company’s lawyers, the Securities and Exchange Commission wrote to a judge.
articles.abstract: Mr. Musk violated a settlement when he published information about production goals without seeking approval from his company’s lawyers, the Securities and Exchange Commission wrote to a judge.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk has put himself in legal trouble with a post on Twitter. Again.

articles.headline: Seeking a New Mayor, Chicago Sees Many Black Residents Voting With Their Feet
articles.snippet: As Chicagoans prepare to vote in a new mayor, the city stands at a pivotal crossroads, with black residents leaving by the thousands even as new white residents flow in.
articles.abstract: As Chicagoans prepare to vote in a new mayor, the city stands at a pivotal crossroads, with black residents leaving by the thousands even as new white residents flow in.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — The glitz of downtown, the influx of tech jobs, the tourist dollars pouring into city coffers: None of those things are keeping many in Chicago’s black neighborhoods from loading their belongings into car trunks and moving vans and seeking better lives someplace else.

articles.headline: Burned by Russia, Poland Turns to U.S. for Natural Gas and Energy Security
articles.snippet: Liquid natural gas producers from Qatar, Norway and the U.S. are in line to deliver enough fuel to keep the lights on in Poland — and to complicate relations between Russia and the U.S.
articles.abstract: Liquid natural gas producers from Qatar, Norway and the U.S. are in line to deliver enough fuel to keep the lights on in Poland — and to complicate relations between Russia and the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: SWINOUJSCIE, Poland — Gargantuan tankers pull into this port on the Baltic Sea twice a month, ferrying liquid natural gas from producers in Qatar, Norway and, increasingly, the United States. The fuel will help light and heat millions of Polish homes, while gradually cutting the country’s dependence on coal.

articles.headline: On Eve of Michael Cohen’s Testimony, Republican Threatens to Reveal Compromising Information
articles.snippet: Mr. Cohen, President Trump’s former lawyer, will testify in public on Wednesday and plans to paint an unflattering portrait of the president.
articles.abstract: Mr. Cohen, President Trump’s former lawyer, will testify in public on Wednesday and plans to paint an unflattering portrait of the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In an atmosphere of high drama and low tactics, Michael D. Cohen, President Trump’s former lawyer, prepared for his explosive public testimony about the president on Wednesday even as a Republican member of Congress threatened to reveal what he said were Mr. Cohen’s extramarital affairs.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: U.S. Loses Appeal Seeking to Block AT&T-Time Warner Merger
articles.snippet: The federal government lost its second bid to halt the blockbuster transaction, which has already begun to reshape much of the media industry.
articles.abstract: The federal government lost its second bid to halt the blockbuster transaction, which has already begun to reshape much of the media industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: The federal government on Tuesday lost its second court challenge to AT&T’s $85.4 billion merger with Time Warner, a blockbuster deal that has already begun to reshape much of the media industry.
articles.byline: By Edmund Lee and Cecilia Kang
